projects.title: üê¶ Fern & Feather Paper Co. - Website
projects.description: Explore the custom calligraphy of Fern and Feather Paper Co. through this clean, elegant, and user-friendly website. This website is designed using a purely React + CSS front end along with a form created using the React-Bootstrap framework. The intention with this website was to provide a very smooth and interactive experience for endusers to promote the beauty of the products that Feather & Fern Paper Co. creates. The page can adapt to screen sizes as large as a 27 inch monitor down to a mobile phone size seamlessly. The app is deployed using Heroku.

image.alt: Screenshot of Feather & Fern Paper Co. Hero page

projects.title: üê¶ Tweet Search Showcase
projects.description: Find Your Tweety is your new off-platform search engine to find the most recent Twitter Tweets by content, user timelines, hashtags, and user mentions. There's also a Tweet Surprise! page that showcases a random tweet from one of my top 5 favorite Twitter handles!    UPDATE: Due to changes in Twitter's development platform tiers, Find Your Tweety is no longer functional.

image.alt: Screenshot of Find Your Tweety search page

projects.description: This app uses Axios through React and Javascript to retrieve character data from the swapi.dev API and uses React-Bootstrap to for style.

projects.title: üíµ Expense Tracker
projects.description: The game ends when you collide with a wall or the snake accidentally 'eats' itself. Score resets after each round, what will your high score be? Through developing this game I learned how to modulate similar functions in code to make it more readable and easier to edit in the future. Learning how to utilize a gameboard was a fun challenge that really played into the logic behind code that I enjoy so much.
